Reviews.Title: “Great value in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: BeyondRachel
Reviews.Content: Accomodation in HK is always hideously high and has been rocketing over the years. This is a new hotel in western area of HK island, not that centrally located, but well, HK island is of that size, it cannot be too inconvenient. We got upgraded to a suite, you cannot expect too much of a HK hotel because the size must be small considering the city's limited living space, but the suite is quite well-equiped, a bedroom and a living room with fridge and sink and cupboards and a small dining table, TV-set and sofa. Quite decent. The only shortcoming is that the water flows a bit slowly in the shower. Breakfast is basic but ok, and included in the fare.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room”
Reviews.Author: Kaelar
Reviews.Content: Hotel LBP was exactly what I wanted for my stay in Hong Kong. It was close enough to walk everywhere (or transport was very close by) but quiet so sleep at night came easy. The room was very well equipped and everything I needed was in there. The rooms are also of a good size (being in HK) and the shower was great after a long day of walking around. There are some great little coffee shops close by and restaurants for dinner etc are only a walk away. Breakfast is basic but all that you needed to start the day off. The free snacks and drinks are great too. I found the staff helpful and pleasant. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Neat room and fair location.. Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: dmtl28
Reviews.Content: Some staffs are freindly but others don't really care. Nice room, okay location, free internet which is a life saver. Overall very good for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: floppybunz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located quite a walk from the Sheung Wan MTR station. Tiresome if you are going to be ladden with heavy bags of shopping. So it may be more convenient to hitch a ride on the trams or buses, which stop a block or so behind the hotel. The suites have a decent size, good layout and nice decor. Still a bit of a squeeze here and there, but fine for a couple. Bathroom amenities like shampoo, hair rinse and body wash are of good quality, and come in adequate 60ml containers refreshed every day. You get a big bottle of water and two small ones with compliments daily, adequate for making tea in-room (sadly no instant coffee packs, sugar or milkmare supplied; only peppermint and camomile tea packs). The hotel is generous with an open pantry when you can help yourself freely to sodas, snacks, fruits, Nespresso coffee and a small continental breakfast every day. There is also a small selection of DVDs, CDs and books you can borrow without having to sign in and out. The free usage of two laptops in the pantry is also much welcome. Overall, service staff are efficient and cordial. Don't expect any warmth or personality from them. A pity, because that may have induced us to return more assuredly, rather than contemplate trying the somewhat similar but 50% cheaper 60 West located at the tram stops behind (although the latter took a whole week to respond to our enquiries and was thus passed over this time).

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience, def a recommend”
Reviews.Author: Yonghui W
Reviews.Content: Like the hotel a lot, not too much room, as most of the hotels in Hong Kong, but definitely enough. You can rent/borrow dvds on the 4th floor and grab sodas without additional charge. I recommend the Lux Room over the Business Suite. Spent two days in the Lux Rm and one in the Business Suite. Only difference is the additional "living" room, which you won't really use unless you would need to meet ppl in room. Wifi is free and pretty fast, which is good. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel making a great start! Will be back”
Reviews.Author: ianinsaigon
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights with Agoda with the intention to move on but ended up staying for 8 - showing how good it is. We thought it was value for money for Hong Kong although this may be just an introductory offer - seemed cheap at the time. Some may think location is out of the centre a little but with easy access to the Transport system and trams we didn't mind but enjoyed adventuring round the local neighbourhood. The rooms were great but we had to stay in two different ones due to our extended stay - the executive room on the higher floor had a little lounge area and kitchenette which was a nice bonus. The breakfast was basic (cafe style) and the gym was being added to even during our stay although I think I was the only one using it though. All in all, the staff couldn't be more helpful and they seem to know what they are doing - GOOD LUCK LBP!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Sheng Wan”
Reviews.Author: Totothecat
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rate, great staff, good location in old Sheng Wan area. Also liked free breakfast and fast WiFi in the room. Negative points are, if any, noise from other room and very small bed for luxury twin. Will recommend budget tourist and business traveler who prefers good old HK over high rises.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Sheung Wan district”
Reviews.Author: MetalRabbit
Reviews.Content: Hotel LBP is a relatively new hotel not too far from the Sheung Wan metro station. Everything has been designed with attention to detail and there is a kind of clean "European industrial" feel to the generally black, gray and white color scheme. For Hong Kong standards, the room was reasonably-sized and designed to make the most out of the space. A bonus is that breakfast is included, nothing fancy, but enough. There is also a small balcony outside of the small breakfast area. The staff was very gracious and helpful. I will definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money & a very comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kamal_Narang
Reviews.Content: A lovely new hotel in Sheung Wan. About 10 mins walking distance from the nearest Metro station. Locate between the 4th and 20th floors of a commercial building - the hotel has everything to boast for. A small coffee shop which serves amazing hot breakfasts every morning to free wi-fi in each guest room. The staff is very polite and accommodating. Initially I thought the price was high but it is really good value for money at around USD 120/night inclusive of taxes. They do not have a room service restaurant but the location is filled with them around. There is a super market, chemist, photo lab, metro and the main busy downtown street is just around the corner as well so there is nothing to complain about. The rooms are nice, moderately sized, fitted with amazing toiletries, hair dryer, lcd tv and a very good view of the sea from some rooms. Almost everything you can ask for in a good hotel. If not for the location and if they had their own building, this hotel would easily be charging double the rates. Highly recommended if you do not mind walking 10 to 15 mins every day to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and decent location, but lil' pricey for offerings”
Reviews.Author: midnyterambla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice. It's a short walk to the Sheung Wan station on the Island Line and a HKD20-25 ride from Central/Lan Kwai Fong area. Overall, the rooms are very clean and newly renovated - looks like they have a corporate discount at Ikea and/or West Elm. The beds are firm and rooms are pretty well insulated against noise. The bathrooms are compact but very efficient. Water takes a minute to warm-up, but it'll get firey hot if you like an especially toasty shower. My complaints are few if any. The hotel shares the building with other offices, so you have to go thru a general entryway to get to the lobby on the 4th Floor which can be a little confusing, especially when you're meeting people in the "lobby". The immediate neighborhood is nice and safe, but you have to walk a few minutes to get a coffee, sandwich, dinner, etc. Therefore, you are very CLOSE to the happening neighborhood of SoHo/Lan Kwai Fong, but you're *in* said neighborhoods. I paid over $1100 for a single for four (4) nights during the New Year holiday, which I thought was a bit much to be very-close-but-not-in-the-neighborhood I was partying in.

Reviews.Title: “New and convenient hotel within walking distance of the MTR”
Reviews.Author: cat666
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed in a Business Suite for three nights. So glad we did this instead of getting a regular room, as even this was on the small side. Still, it was nice to have a separate space with a small dining table and a kitchen area. The kitchenette could have done with a microwave, there was certainly enough space for it. The bedroom had excellent black-out curtains, which I wish was standard in every hotel room, but isn't always. The bed was nice and firm. The layout in the bedroom was slightly odd, as the bedroom door opened onto the closet door, and they were always clashing. The full length mirror in the bedroom closet was smoked and dark, so although it looked nice, you couldn't really use it for make-up or getting dressed as you could hardly see in it. The bathroom was tiny and functional, with frosted glass windows and doors. A bit of a gap in the door. I'm not sure how comfortable I would be sharing this room with someone I wasn't very familiar with. The rain shower wasn't powerful enough which was a shame, and the drain was on the side of the wall instead of on the floor, so the water wouldn't drain properly. I'm putting pictures up of their nice comfortable breakfast room which had a simple but effective spread of fruit, toast, tea, and coffee. Overall, the room was well sound proofed, which is a big deal to me. The best thing for me was that you could walk to the MTR quite easily. It took about seven minutes to walk there. I timed it one morning. However, if you're the type who gets totally bored waiting for the elevators to arrive, then don't stay here! We're usually quite patient, but because this hotel is in a mixed-use building (there were offices and residences, I think), we waited quite often, and quite long for the elevators. Not a deal breaker, but something to consider. They had free wifi in the rooms, which we used. Oh, and they provided complimentary Hampstead Tea bags from London, which are organic and fairtrade. We got chamomile, peppermint, and ginger and lemon. I know it sounds lame, but I love getting the same type of tea that I drink at home!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, contemporary Hong Kong hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellevret
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel mostly because it was a busy weekend, and this was by far the best price I could find. I was very pleased, though it will not be the place for everyone. Cons: -Rooms are very small--hardly any place to put a suitcase. -Shower entry is small--a very large person might not be able to get into it due to narrow entry. -Lobby is on fourth floor, hotel are on a few floors of high-rise--not your typical hotel layout. -No MTR (metro) close, though I think new stations are being built, and there is a tram and buses nearby -Taxi drivers not so sure of location -Wait for elevator could be long Pros: -My room overlooked a garden--not another building! (This is kind of a big deal in Hong Kong) -Very clean, modern room. Small, but upscale -Nice extras--a box of quality shampoo, conditioner, etc. -Boutique feel, small but upscale -Free wifi -Great neighborhood -Check-in service was outstanding. Generally good service. -Really feel like you are in Hong Kong--locals live and work in this building -Free (though simple) breakfast. Nice deck. -Nice, comfortable bed. I really like the area, which is now my favorite to stay in Hong Kong. Hollywood Road is the oldest road in Hong Kong, and has lots of antique shops and Western bars and cafes. It is a nice walk to soho and not far from the harbour and Sun Yat-sen park. Hollywood park across the street is small, but very nice. Overall, I really enjoyed this hotel. Another guest complained about the shower not draining properly and also was having trouble with the key card not working on the elevator. I don't think I would have wanted to share my small room with anyone, but as a solo traveler it was almost perfect--if only there was a suitcase stand.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: DanielHOz
Reviews.Content: Modern inside. Nice rooms. Close walk to Trams and car tunnel access. Breakfast was refreshingly light and good choice. Not the usual heavy buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: grubduck
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a business suite. The opening prices are very competitive at the moment. Glad we chose the larger business suite as it was a bit more roomy than the luxury king we had originally booked. It was still quite compact, but it had a separate living area so gave the 2 of us a little more space. Had a look in a luxury king and they are tiny, even by HK standards! As the hotel is very new, everything was fresh and the staff are great - really friendly and they try to make your stay pleasant. We found the room quiet and secure. Breakfast was included, but quite simple, however Hollywood Road is right outside the door, so there are plenty of other options if you don't want the hotel breakfast. It is a short walk in the other direction to Des Voeux Road where you can catch one of the cute HK trams. We arrived from the Macao ferry and the hotel was only a 10 minute walk from the ferry terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely finished rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: frank b
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a few days , got a business suite . Very nicely finished rooms ,very modern . Good location ,Restaurants close by, short taxi ride to soho . Free Wifi access in room and breakfast included ( breakfast was a bit dissappointing but was free)
